intro: Microstylis micholitziana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved microstylis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Microstylis micholitziana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
